911675008:
[

Senior Legal Officer

Company Name NSW Environment Protection Authority (EPA) Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Multiple Legal Roles (Litigation; Legislation & Advice)
  • Provide expert legal advice regarding environmental regulatory laws
  • Engage with key internal and external stakeholders
  • Work in a strong team of expert lawyers
The NSW Environment Protection Authority (EPA) is the State‘s primary environmental regulator. The EPA works to protect the community and the environment as a leader, partner and protector. With a vision for New South Wales to have a healthy environment, healthy community and healthy business, EPA believes healthy ecosystems are the foundation for healthy communities, a healthy economy and for enhancing liveability. EPA leads in protecting the air, waterways and land to ensure a healthy community for the future; works with communities, government and business to reduce the impact on the environment; and holds people and organisations to account through licensing, monitoring, regulation and enforcement.

The EPA’s Legal Branch provides a specialist in-house legal service to the EPA across all areas of its work. The Branch has multiple legal roles available across the areas of Litigation and Legislation & Advice at the Senior Legal Officer (Environment Officer Class 9) level.

There are ongoing and 12-month minimum fixed term contract roles available.

These roles are available due to an increased volume of legal work and provide a great opportunity to work across a range of environmental issues.

Litigation roles

Reporting to a Principal Legal Officer, you will prepare and conduct litigation for the EPA to enforce environmental laws, support the development and administration of environmental legislation and provide training and education to compliance officers.

Key Accountabilities Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Assist compliance officers to investigate offences, prepare and conduct complex prosecutions and civil enforcement litigation to address contentious, long-term and emergent issues and to enforce and support the administration of environmental legislation.
  • Prepare and conduct complex cases defending the administration of environmental laws to maximise positive environmental outcomes.
  • Provide high quality legal and policy advice to stakeholders on complex litigation issues to ensure the effective resolution of legal issues.
  • Participate in the delivery of legal and investigative education seminars and training programs.
  • Develop and maintain cooperative, productive and professional working relationships with key stakeholders.
To be successful, you will be a mid level lawyer, with strong litigation experience. In addition, you will ideally have knowledge in legislation administered by the EPA and legislation relating to criminal and civil enforcement, and also knowledge of environmental principles and practices and exposure to the complexity of the environmental debate. You will have strong attention to detail and excellent organisational and stakeholder management skills and experience in the provision of complex legal advice at a senior level. You must be admitted or immediately eligible to hold a practising certificate in NSW.

Legislation & Advice roles

Reporting to a Principal Legal Officer, you will provide advice on a range of compliance and regulatory issues, draft legal documentation, participate in legislative reform, and provide training and education.

Key Accountabilities Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Provide high quality professional research and advice to stakeholders on environment protection, administrative law, machinery of government and agency contract, lease and grant arrangements to assist with the effective resolution of legal issues.
  • Draft and review legal documentation.
  • Develop relevant and contemporary legislation and contribute to the legislative review program to ensure the achievement of corporate objectives of the EPA, within the framework of the Government agenda.
  • Contribute to the development and participate in the delivery of legal education seminars and compliance programs.
To be successful, you will be a mid level lawyer, with strong government, regulatory or environmental law experience. In addition, you will ideally have expertise in legislation administered by the EPA, and also knowledge of environmental principles and practices and exposure to the complexity of the environmental debate. You will have strong attention to detail and excellent organisational and stakeholder management skills. You must be admitted or immediately eligible to hold a practising certificate in NSW.

Click here to view Role Description

Our commitment to diversity

EPA values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups and those with disability. We are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.

Please Note: The successful candidates will need to undertake background checks and criminal record checks.

Applications Closing Date

For a candidate information pack, please contact Ciara Lui at Oceans Group Search and Selection - ciaral@oceansgroup.com.au. Should you require additional information prior to making an application please call Ciara on 02 9873 0017.

Location: Sydney. The EPA will be moving to Parramatta in 2019-2020.

Applications close 11.59 pm Sunday, 28 October 2018.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Environmental Services
  • Government Administration

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Legal
  • Other
  • Consulting

Avenir Capital is a global equities investment manager and is majority owned by its staff. Avenir was founded in 2011 to apply a private equity mindset to invest in a concentrated selection of publicly listed companies with a focus on risk minimisation and long-term compounding of capital.


Avenir’s team focuses on building research-driven conviction in individual investment ideas to allow a truly long-term orientation and seek to identify opportunities others fail to see.


We are looking for investment analysts with 3 or more years of work experience to join our Sydney-based global equities team.


Responsibilities include but not limited to:


  • Company and industry research and writing of investment reports
  • Monitoring individual portfolio positions for recent company news and events
  • Ongoing idea generation by reading widely and monitoring industry and regional developments, industry conferences, investment publications, etc
  • Development of the Avenir profile in public and in interactions with third parties
  • Working with all members of Avenir Capital to ensure compliance with regulatory and license requirements in all jurisdictions in which Avenir operates at any point in time

  • Ability to conduct well-reasoned and detailed analysis on companies and industries across a wide range of countries and industries.
  • Ability to\xa0\xa0identify key risks across investment ideas and integrate those risks into their investment analysis and recommendations
  • Buy or sell-side experience is valued, but not a requirement – rather, we are looking for numerate people who share our passion for global long-term investing.

\xa0

We value team players who are self-starters and understand the companies we invest in and the industries in which they operate.


A natural curiosity in the world around us and the ability to communicate well are essential.

\xa0

Avenir is a Sydney-based global, long-only fund manager.

Librarian

Company Name Northern Beaches Council Company Location Northern Beaches Council, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Librarian

Permanent, Part – Time, 42 hours per fortnight

Salary Range = $71,109 - $82,641/- pa on pro rata basis (subject to skills and experience)

The Business Unit


The purpose of the Northern Beaches Library Service is; Libraries for Life, Enhancing Leisure and Learning. The service:

Provides efficient customer focused library services that deliver value to our community

Provides library facilities and opportunities for literacy, lifelong learning, creativity, work, relaxation and play, and Develops staff capabilities and undertakes business initiatives to make on-going service improvements for our community.

There are six library branches across the Northern Beaches Local Government Area; Dee Why, Glen Street, Forestville, Manly, Mona Vale, Warringah Mall and four Community Libraries at Avalon, Terrey Hills, Seaforth and Harbord.

Our library branches implement and manage library loans, programs, local history, genealogy, information and digital resources. Remote access is also available to our online catalogue and e-Resources.


The Role and Responsibilities


The Librarian role is a key role within the Library Services Group. The Librarian provides the technical process knowledge and the advisory subject matter knowledge needed by the various customers of the Library. They will be required to coordinate and perform a variety of back office functions as required, such as, selection of collections, designing programs, assisting customers with digital access to books and information, while also leading the customer facing front office functions like desk and concierge services as well as organising and running events.


This role also frequently exercises supervisory functions on a day to day basis, running a shift of staff at a Branch Library.


Provide friendly and efficient customer service in a desk or

concierge role


Provide high quality reference, information, and referral

services to the public


Assist customers with accessing services or equipment, connecting their own electronic devices and in locating resources


*** Whilst this position description covers the key areas of responsibilities, this list is not exhaustive. Day to day tasks and responsibilities may vary and be in addition to those listed above (reasonably and within the limits of individual skills, competence and training)


Selection Criteria

  • A university degree or equivalent which allows eligibility for professional membership of the Australian Library and Information Association (ALIA).
  • Demonstrated track record of delivering high quality customer service
  • Proven ability to work independently as well as within a small team
  • Computer literate with a demonstrated ability to use library computer software, Microsoft Office software, and office equipment.
  • Demonstrated ability to use a variety of digital formats and social media (tablets and smartphones)


Please refer to the Position Description for further information including a full list of Selection Criteria.


How to apply

  • Apply online and upload the following information
  • A current Resume
  • A covering letter (maximum 2 page) outlining systematically, addressing the selection criteria listed within the position description.
  • For further information please contact Liam Pucher on 02 9942 2200during business hours
  • Applications close Thursday 25 October, 2018

Company Name Adelaide Brighton Ltd Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Location: Region NSW
Work Type: Permanent - Full Time (EBA)

The role

We currently have opportunities for Heavy Rigid (HR) licenced truck drivers to join our fleet of concrete agitator truck drivers. Based out of our Dapto site, you will be responsible for the loading and delivery of pre-mixed concrete to our customer sites as well as general duties and housekeeping as required.

If you hold a HR licence this is the job for you. We will train you in all areas required to become an experienced Concrete Agitator Driver who will deliver pre-mixed concrete to our customers.

If you are looking for an opportunity to work in a friendly supportive team where your contribution will be valued, this is the job for you. To be successful in this role you will enjoy working with a wide variety of customers daily, be flexible and approachable, feel pride in doing a good job, and have a strong commitment to health and safety. This is a great opportunity to gain specialised driving experience in a secure and growing industry.

Responsibilities
  • Ensure safety, health and environment standards are maintained
  • Deliver concrete to clients' sites
  • Manage concrete slump tolerance levels and the discharge of concrete
  • Complete basic documentation associated with the collection and delivery of concrete
  • Maintain professional customer relationships
  • Maintain the vehicle in a clean and tidy condition
  • Undertake general duties including plant cleaning and housekeeping


What You Will Need To Succeed
  • Current HR (Heavy Rigid) drivers licence
  • Strong commitment to health and safety
  • Relevant concrete industry experience will be highly regarded, however full training will be provided
  • Flexibility to work in a small team environment and assist with other duties as required
  • Current white card
  • A reliable team player attitude with a focus on customer service

Our business

Hy-Tec is a leading quality assured supplier of concrete and aggregates to the commercial, industrial, civil and residential construction sectors. We focus on accurate delivery times with support from a large fleet of concrete trucks for best in class on time delivery.

Part of the Adelaide Brighton Limited Concrete and Aggregates Division, Hy-Tec’s concrete plants service south east Queensland, Sydney and Melbourne, northern New South Wales and the Northern Territory. We have strategic aggregate reserves west of Sydney, in northern New South Wales, Queensland and the Northern Territory. The South Australian operations of the Concrete and Aggregates Division include Southern Quarries, Direct Mix Concrete and Davalan Concrete through which we supply concrete and aggregates and agricultural lime to the South Australian market.

Hy-Tec is a subsidiary of Adelaide Brighton Limited, a leading Australian construction materials company with operations that comprise cement and lime, concrete and aggregates and concrete products and employs 1,500 people nationally

Applications close Sunday 21 October 2018

Senior Manager - North Shore + Northern Beaches

Company Name Xtend Barre\xae Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 59 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Xtend Barre is the world's premier ballet barre workout and is unlike any other exercise you've ever tried.

Xtend Barre is a full body workout with foundations in pilates and ballet - it is unique in that it's high intensity but low impact. It challenges every kind of body, from beginners, to the fittest athletes around.

Our classes challenge both the mind and body by incorporating cardiovascular endurance, balance, flexibility, coordination, core strength and upper body strength, all at once.

You'll sweat, get strong and get results fast!

This is a HUGE opportunity in the boutique health and fitness industry for the right person.

Xtend Barre Northern Beaches is looking for an organized, dedicated, results driven, self starter who is passionate about Xtend Barre to help manage our three (soon to be 4!) Northern Beaches Studios.


About the Role

We are seeking an enthusiastic and skilled Senior Studio Manager to lead our driven and hardworking team. This position will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of our 4 studios.

A largely sales based role, you will manage all new client leads coming into our head office via phone, emails and the website.

With a passion for providing outstanding customer service, it will also be your responsibility to lead the in-house sales function across our studios. You will be responsible for creating a warm, motivating and inspiring community for studio members to achieve their goals.

You will provide daily direction to two part-time assistant managers on everything from client retention to community engagement, community events, instructor management and class schedules and timetables.

Beyond this, you may also be required to:

  • Grow brand awareness and generate members/leads through attention-grabbing pre-sale events, marketing outreach and local community events
  • Hire and train new staff to develop a high-performance team and coach individuals to reach their full potential
  • Develop a kind, client focused studio culture through in-studio challenges, social media channels and member engagement
  • Model all studio activities through self-involvement (leading by example)
  • Responsible for meeting performance metrics in relation to revenue, ordering, inventory, cost controls and facilities maintenance
  • Provide and maintain the highest level of customer service
  • Implement your customer service skills to diplomatically resolve any staff/member matters
  • You would also help maintain the upkeep of the studios and oversee the retail section, assisting with making new retails orders and visual merchandising on a weekly basis.

Working knowledge of technology (using software systems such as Mind Body + Gymleads and social media) is a huge plus, but the ability to learn quickly and take on new tasks with a can-do attitude is even more important.

We are looking for someone who thrives on a challenge, can multi-task efficiently and and is highly motivated to lead a team to create positive change for the Mosman + Northern Beaches community.


Benefits and Perks

Generous annual salary plus performance bonus

Unlimited Xtend Barre Membership

Working from various locations on Sydney's stunning Northern Beaches!


Skills and experience

Are you:

  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Previous management experience
  • Previous sales experience
  • Experience in providing motivation, support, guidance to a team
  • Excellent leadership skills
  • Experience in overseeing all aspects of staff management, including hiring and developing
  • Strong understanding of sales and operational excellence
  • Strong organisational skills
  • Positive, motivating, and effective communication skills
  • Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
  • Takes ownership of every role to obtain optimum results

We encourage a wonderful team culture and a supportive environment for our staff to learn and grow in their respective positions every day and for our clients to have an amazing experience every single time they come through our doors.

This is the perfect opportunity for a hard working individual to learn the ins and outs of running a boutique fitness studio from the ground up. It is a new position that will continue to evolve and challenge the right person.

Job description

Tasmania’s largest private employer – Federal Group – is seeking a highly skilled and enthusiastic accounting professional to be based in Hobart. Working closely with the Group Financial Controller and the Tourism Commercial Manager, and having one direct report, this position will focus on the Group’s Tourism businesses which currently comprise The Henry Jones Art Hotel, Saffire Freycinet, and MACq 01 Hotel. This is a diverse role covering both management and financial accounting with an emphasis on driving process improvement.


This is undoubtedly a smart career move thanks to our proven history of promoting from within and the diversity and scale of our businesses. We employ approximately 2,400 people across the tourism, hospitality, gaming and transport industries, with our brands also including Wrest Point, Country Club Tasmania, 9/11 Bottle shops and Cope Sensitive Freight.


This role ideal for a CPA or CA with a can-do attitude who is ready to make their mark with a high profile and dynamic business. In addition to your undeniable professional know-how and first-class communication and relationship building skills, in this role you will also be:


  • rewarded for your strong financial background and expertise in reporting
  • appreciated for your curiosity and passion for contemporary financial practices and continuous improvement
  • valued for your innate leadership ability and the natural way you bring out the best in others and
  • recognised for your ability to achieve impressive results and meet deadlines in a fast-paced team environment.

In addition to a competitive salary and the career development opportunities this role presents, you will also enjoy free parking, access to our extensive employee benefits program and our commitment to employee development.


For more information about this opportunity please send your contact details to HRcorporate@federalgroup.com.au and will give you a call.


Your application should include your resume and a written statement (maximum 500 words) addressing how your skills and experience fit the role responsibilities.


Applications will be considered as they are received and the closing date is Sunday 21 October 2018.

An Invitation to Join Our Team\xa0 -\xa0Commencing in January 2019

A unique opportunity exists for experienced, progressive and innovative educators to fulfil the following senior Leadership Roles as a result of a future-focused reshaping of our services to schools:


1. Faith and Care Leader

2. School and System Improvement Leader

3. Teaching and Learning Leader (K-12) Primary Focus

4. Teaching and Learning Leader (K-12) Secondary Focus

5. Professional Learning and Development Leader


These positions are pivotal in leading and managing teams within the respective fields of service, inspiring innovation, promoting excellence and shaping the future direction of Catholic Education Diocese of Wagga Wagga in a collaborative partnership with our System of schools and their communities.


The successful applicant will be required to undergo a National Criminal History Check and Working With Children Check
